#VIKTOR!

It's been four years since his last appearance in lore!

A cult revolving around a ridiculous deity instead of around science, where people as mindless drones place their severed bodyparts and organs to rot on the altar?

This is horrible.

Dammit, 333lom! I have not gotten that far, I've barely just begun!

But please, feel free to begin rioting; I'll make my own judgement soon enough when I know what Riot has done.

I'm afraid, Viktor's story is not even out yet, but Riot missed the point of his character by SO MUCH

Like, the acolytes are literally copies of the Techpriests from WH40K

> [{quoted}](name=333lom,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=i9d3ckvI,comment-id=00040000000100000000,timestamp=2016-11-29T20:44:46.294+0000)
>
> I'm afraid, Viktor's story is not even out yet, but Riot missed the point of his character by SO MUCH
> 

You are right to fear, and I share your trepidation. However, while I am resigned to confronting Riot's poor decision, there may yet be hope. Viktor's narrative has always involved people stealing something from him and twisting it to their own ends, such as Urgot. I noticed there is no mention of Viktor anywhere despite the fact that his name would be first and foremost associated with the Glorious Evolution.

It may be possible that Viktor's concept of The Glorious Evolution has been perverted by the population at large within Zaun, especially by the poor and desperate. I can easily see Viktor providing augmentations to those who willingly volunteer to be altered, more than likely not improving their life, while also trying to spread the word that augmentations can not only help but enhance someone's existence. Viktor educates, lectures, but people pick up on the wrong idea, they take what should be objective fact and twist it into salvation.

Once more, the world spoils Viktor's vision.

> Like, the acolytes are literally copies of the Techpriests from WH40K

I'm not surprised, considering one of member of the narrative team is known for his works in the 40K universe. Unfortunate, I suppose, though I've always suspected something of the sort from the moment Viktor was joined by acolytes. I never thought it was so extreme though.

Your idea is my lifeline, but I highly doubt it. When was lore that complicated and elaborate. Here's a reason for my doubt:

I'm getting a feeling that Viktor might get turned into something like the God Emperor. See? This is horrible.
Then we have an obligation to present Riot with their mistake as much as necessary until they break and rectify the issue.

I personally don't see your problem here.
Now, now, before you get your pitchforks hear me out.

The Glorious Evolution, to the uneducated mind, which mind you most of Zaun's population consists of, can seem as a MIRACLE.
Replacing the weak flesh, riding you of your shortcomings, overcome the limitations of your body.

For them Viktor and the glorious evolutions are their SALVATION, Their Savior!
It already is an established Zaunite tradition to offer something in order to pray for greater progress. Them just offering the parts they have shed for the glorious evolution isn't as macabre and fanatic as it may seem.

I see it as yet again something that outsiders may frown upon, yet if you think about it is just as logical as offering some animal carcass. It's sacred, it's symbolic, it's something the COMMON people can rally behind.

Viktor is ABOVE the aristocracy, he accepts the common folk under his wing, be it poor, deformed or anything in between, you're all equal under the glorious evolution.
I don't see it as something that ruins his character, it just characterizes his followers.

The "Sacrifice" to the Gray Lady....

No, this whole thing just feels wrong. It sounds wrong. Viktor **educates** people, he isn't a god or a priest.

Now, I'm a huge Viktor fan but NEVER did he show any interest in educating people.
He wants to Herald the glorious evolution, because he sees it as humanity's next step.
Whatever his acolytes do with that information is up to them, maybe they seek meaning that Viktor can't give them?

Religion is a powerful tool, especially for those living in the dump that is Zaun. Something that brings them comfort, that brings answers to their questions.
Viktor leading a church strays his character too much from the original scientist who wants to be recognized in the scientific community.

Do we even know HE leads it?
Maybe it's just the religion his followers created to rally behind an idea, an image they can all understand?
Not everyone sees the science behind it.

Such an image, regardless of whether he leads it or not, is bad. It's not the case that the only thing that can be bad is if he was a cartoon-villain.
Him being turned into a fanatic that believes in some machine gods is also very bad. Why? We wanted Nikola Tesla of LoL. We got.. a ripoff of Techpriests from Warhammer 40k.

I don't get why riot has some kind of grudge against viktor (no skins, fkd up lore, pbe changes) 

Y U DO DIS RITO

I'm waiting for zaun part.

I approached the shrine. There were jars of organs. Single eyeballs floated like pickled eggs. Bundled offerings were wrapped in linen, some of it fine, some of it oily and ragged. The gauze of the newfound treasure caught on the edge, and the rest of the bundle tumbled away, revealing a desiccated finger. The rat scampered down, but Brother Zavier shooed it back into the darkness.
